sentences.sCn: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.sContent: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.sCn: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

sentences.sContent: ...i leave it to the reader's political preference to decide which...
...when in comes time for university graduates to decide their next step in life...
...I’ll call you back if we don’t decide to drive...
...What did the man decide to do...
...and try to decide which to pay...
...for instance, you don't go and stand at any kind of cash register when you decide to pay...
...You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2with a single line through the centre...
...You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre...
...decide on your own system for marking...
...then decide that they want something nicer for themselves...

phrases.pCn: 作对…有利的决定；赞成做某事
vt. 考虑后决定；对…作出决定
决定不；作出不利于…的判决

words.tran: 决定性的；果断的，坚定的
明确的；显然的；坚决的，果断的

trans.tranOther: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments
